Cal Cunningham received a: 38,000 tax credit for renovations to his house, which is considered a historic property.
The: butler’s pantry" and "wet bar" were two terms used by an inspector to describe the same area in Cunningham’s kitchen, indicating that they are not two separate areas.
Cunningham: s application for the tax credits included notes from an inspector, revealing each part of the house under consideration for renovations.
State records show that Cunningham spent: 129,536 on renovations to his home and received $38,860 in tax credits, granted to him in installments over the course of five years.
